risk_description: SignalR connection instability and latency exceeding the <2s requirement for real-time technician tracking under high concurrency (10,000 users), leading to poor user experience and SLA breaches.
root_cause: Mobile network volatility combined with potential socket exhaustion on the backend if Azure SignalR Service is not correctly scaled or configured with a Redis backplane.
mitigation_strategy: Implement Azure SignalR Service with 'Default' service mode for auto-scaling. Configure Redis backplane for multi-instance synchronization. Implement client-side location interpolation to smooth movement visuals during packet loss.
contingency_plan: Fallback to polling mechanism (every 5-10s) via standard REST API if WebSocket connection cannot be established or maintained.
monitoring_trigger: SignalR connection drop rate > 5% or E2E message latency > 1.5s for 5 consecutive minutes.

risk_description: PostGIS spatial queries for service center routing (ST_Contains on complex polygons) causing high CPU load and latency spikes on the primary database during peak registration times.
root_cause: Complex geofenced polygons with excessive vertices combined with synchronous processing of service requests on the main transactional database node.
mitigation_strategy: Enforce vertex limits on polygons in UI. Implement GiST spatial indexing on the database. Offload read-heavy spatial queries to PostgreSQL read replicas.
contingency_plan: Implement a simplified bounding box check as a primary filter before executing precise polygon queries to reduce computational load.
monitoring_trigger: Database CPU utilization > 80% or Service Request creation latency > 400ms.

risk_description: Technician mobile app background location services being killed by aggressive Android/iOS battery optimizations, resulting in gaps in tracking data and inaccurate ETAs.
root_cause: Native OS restrictions on background processes and lack of 'foreground service' configuration or motion-activity recognition integration.
mitigation_strategy: Implement 'react-native-background-geolocation' with motion-change detection (stop GPS when stationary). Configure visible Foreground Service notifications for Android.
contingency_plan: Implement local buffering of coordinates on the device to be batch-uploaded when the app resumes into the foreground.
monitoring_trigger: Gaps in location history timestamps exceeding 5 minutes for active technicians.

risk_description: Offline data synchronization conflicts in the Technician App leading to data loss or corruption when multiple updates occur to the same service ticket from different sources.
root_cause: Lack of a robust conflict resolution strategy in the 'Offline-First' architecture (WatermelonDB/Realm) when syncing queued actions with the backend.
mitigation_strategy: Implement a 'Last-Write-Wins' policy for simple fields and a specialized merge logic for status transitions. Use optimistic UI updates with rollback capabilities on sync failure.
contingency_plan: Force manual user resolution (UI prompt) when a server-side conflict is detected that cannot be auto-resolved.
monitoring_trigger: Sync error rate > 1% of total sync attempts via Application Insights.

risk_description: Azure AD B2C integration complexity leads to improper token validation or role mapping, potentially allowing unauthorized access to cross-tenant data (e.g., Brand Admin accessing another Brand's data).
root_cause: Misconfiguration of Custom Policies in B2C or improper validation of JWT claims (aud, iss, roles) in the backend guards/middleware.
mitigation_strategy: Implement comprehensive integration tests for RBAC. Use standardized JWT validation middleware across both NestJS and .NET services. Enforce strict claim checks.
contingency_plan: Engage Microsoft Identity support specialist for architectural review. Revert to standard User Flows if Custom Policies prove too unstable.
monitoring_trigger: 401/403 Error spikes in API Gateway logs or detection of token signature validation failures.

risk_description: Cost overruns and service throttling from Mapbox API usage due to excessive rendering of map tiles or geocoding requests.
root_cause: Inefficient client-side caching of map tiles or unnecessary re-geocoding of addresses that haven't changed.
mitigation_strategy: Cache geocoding results in the backend database. Use vector tiles for efficient rendering. Set strict quotas and budget alerts in the Mapbox console.
contingency_plan: Switch to Azure Maps as a fallback provider if Mapbox costs become unsustainable or limits are reached.
monitoring_trigger: Mapbox API usage reaching 80% of monthly budget within the first 15 days.

risk_description: Integration delays between the .NET OCR Worker service and the Azure AI Document Intelligence API due to model accuracy issues requiring extensive tuning.
root_cause: Standard pre-built models may not accurately parse diverse invoice formats, requiring custom model training which is time-intensive.
mitigation_strategy: Start testing with pre-built models immediately (Shift Left). Implement a 'Human-in-the-loop' fallback UI where admins can correct OCR confidence failures.
contingency_plan: Reduce scope to only support specific high-volume invoice templates for MVP release.
monitoring_trigger: OCR extraction confidence scores averaging < 85% during initial testing.
